title: City status in the United Kingdom
summary: City status in the United Kingdom is granted by the monarch of the United Kingdom to a select group of communities: as of 2014, there are 69 cities in the United Kingdomâ€”51 in England, 6 in Wales, 7 in Scotland, and 5 in Northern Ireland.[1] Although it carries no special rights, the status of city can be a marker of prestige and confer local pride.[2]
